markers.title: Accessible entrance for Convocation Hall and Simcoe Hall
markers.desc:
Powered exterior door
More powered doors inside
Accessible washroom inside to the right
Elevator inside to the right leads to upper floors of Simcoe Hall ONLY; Convocation hall has no elevators

markers.title: Main Entrance to Convocation Hall
markers.desc:
3 sets of wood doors are the main public entrance
2 steps up to these manual doors

markers.title: Main Entrance to Simcoe Hall
markers.desc: Several stairs up to large non-powered double doors.  Entrances faces north and is clearly visible from King's College Circle.

markers.title: Main entrance to the Visitor's Centre
markers.desc:
Level path leads to a powered door.
Entry faces south and is visible when walking north around King's College Circle.
There is no access to Knox College from this entrance.

markers.title: Main Entrance to Medical Sciences Building
markers.desc:
Several sets of glass powered doors
Under the concrete awning, on the raised concrete patio
There is a wheelchair ramp from King's College circle leading to the concrete patio

markers.title: JJR Macleod Auditorium entrance
markers.desc:
Power glass doors, to your left under the concrete awning.
Across from the entrance to the MSB.
Reachable by ramp from Kings College Circle.
Macleod hall has its own washrooms on the main floor.

markers.title: West wing entrance to Medical Sciences Building
markers.desc:
Manual glass door leading into the west wing.
It is located right at the top of the wheelchair ramp.
This entrance faces east and is not visible from the street.

markers.title: Northeast entrance to Medical Sciences Building
markers.desc:
Manual glass doors at the top of a large covered stair.
Entrance faces east but is not clearly visible from Queen's Park Crescent

markers.title: Accessible entrance to  MSB and CCBR
markers.desc:
Powered glass doors at the top of a long out-door ramp.
*** Ramp subject to closure in winder due to snow.
This leads to the cafe area; MSB (Medical Science is to your right and CCBR (Donnolley building) is to your left.

markers.title: Northwest entrance to Medical Sciences Building
markers.desc: Non-powered door leading to stairwell

markers.title: Southwest entrance
markers.desc: Non-powered door leading to stairwell

markers.title: Entrance to MSB and CCBR
markers.desc: Non-powered glass door at top of large out-door concrete staircase

markers.title: Main entrance to the CCBR
markers.desc:
Powered glass doors at the top of a long low-slope walkway.
(slope of 1:20)
Entrance faces south and is clearly visible from College Street

markers.title: West entrance to McMurrich
markers.desc:
West side door visible from the raised patio at Medical Science.
Go up the zig-zag stairs, under the outdoor overhang and straight ahead.
Non-powered door leading to stairs going up and down. For the elevator, go up or down one half floor.

markers.title: Accessible / Main entrance (Queen's Park side)
markers.desc:
Powered door entrance facing Queens Park West.
There is no parking (or vehicle stop area) off queens park or around this entrance.
The elevator is to the right inside this entrance.
(110816)

markers.title: Loading Bay (non-public entrance)
markers.desc:
This is the loading Bay for McMurrich.
Ring bell for service. Not a public entrance.
For deliveries, leave note in windshield to avoid ticket.
Enter parking area from the King's College Circle side only.

markers.title: Main entrance to The Gerstein Science Information Centre
markers.desc: Manual glass doors at the top of 4 concrete outdoor stairs.  Entrance faces east and is visible from King's College Circle.

markers.title: Accessible entrance to Gerstein Science Information Center
markers.desc:
Powered door located at grade to the left of the main entrance.
Look for the blue awning.
Ring Bell for assistance in opening door.

markers.title: Accessible entrance to Canadiana building
markers.desc:
Powered door at the top of concrete out-door ramp.
There is no parking on this side of the building
(facing Queen's Park West)

markers.title: Accessible entrance to the University of Toronto Student's Union
markers.desc:
Powered door at the top of a low-slope but narrow access ramp.
You may have to ring for access; this is an old wood door that sometimes has difficultly operating properly.

markers.title: Huron St. entrance to Sid Smith
markers.desc:
Powered doors on raised concrete patio.
the patio is reachable by stairs or by a ramp under the awning to the left of the stairs.

markers.title: Main entrance to Sid Smith
markers.desc:
Powered doors facing large raised concrete patio.
*** There is no ramp leading up to the patio from St. George. The doors are powered to provide access to the patio from inside the building.

markers.title: North loading bay entrance to Sid Smith
markers.desc: Powered door from the north loading bay. The slope down to the loading bays from St. George is steep; from the Huron side there is stair access only.

markers.title: Entrance to Sid's Cafe
markers.desc:
Powered doors at the bottom of a steep, rough ramp.
There are also stairs.
Entrance faces Wilcox street.

markers.title: Main entrance to Lash Miller Chemical laboratories
markers.desc:
Powered doors under large awning.
Three steps up with a long low-slope ramp to the right.
Entrance faces St. George street.

markers.title: Rear accessible entrance to Lash Miller
markers.desc: Ramp and stairs leading to powered door. Entrance is located in the rear of the building next to the metal pillars and outdoor seating at the end of the mid-block courtyard.

markers.title: Willcocks entrance to Lash Miller Chemical Laboratories
markers.desc: Manual door one step up from a rough and narrow sidewalk on Willcocks street.  Entrance faces north onto the pedstrian seating area on Willcocks Street.

markers.title: Secondary St. George St. entrance to Lash Miller
markers.desc: Powered door approached by stairs and accessible ramp.  The entrance faces east and is visible from St. George Street.  The curving, accessible ramp at the rear of the building in the exterior courtyard.

markers.title: Main entrance to McLennon Physics
markers.desc:
Powered entrance at grade.
The entrance is only visible from the street looking through the parkette from St. George street.

markers.title: Huron street accessible entrance to McLennon Physics
markers.desc:
Powered door reachable via concrete patio facing Huron street that extends northward along the building face. The ramp to this platform is at the north end of this platform and is steep and uneven.
The entrance is partially visible from the street.

markers.title: Main entrance to Astronomy & Astrophysics Building
markers.desc:
One step up leading to manual door.
Doorway is clearly visible from the street.

markers.title: Secondary entrance to Astronomy & Astrophysics Building
markers.desc:
Non-powered door at grade facing Russell street.
Entrance is clearly visible from the street.

markers.title: Main entrance to Anthropology (accessible)
markers.desc:
5 steps up to powered doors, facing Russell street.
A out-door ramp is located to the left of the stairs.
The entrance is clearly visible from the street.

markers.title: Secondary entrance to Anthropology
markers.desc:
Manual door at the top of 5 stairs.
Clearly visible from Russell street.

markers.title: Main entrance to Ramsey Wright
markers.desc:
Powered door accessible by ramp and stairs.
Entrance is on north side of the building, facing Harbord Ave.
The entrance is set back from the street, but is visible from Harbord.

markers.title: South courtyard entrance to Ramsey Wright
markers.desc:
Manual door reachable by outdoor stairway.
The doorway is on the west side of the building.
It is somewhat visible from the intersection of Harbord and Huron.

markers.title: Secondary entrance to Ramsey Wright
markers.desc:
Manual door reachable by outdoor stairs.
Doorway is on the east side of the building, facing St. George.
This entrance is visible from the street.

markers.title: Northeast entrance to Ramsey Wright
markers.desc:
Secondary entrance.
This is a manual door reachable by outdoor stairs.
Entrance is on the north west corner of the building, facing Huron.
The entrance is visible from Harbord St.

markers.title: Main entrance to John P. Robarts Library
markers.desc:
Powered door at sidewalk grade level.
Entrance is on East side of the building, facing St. George St.
The entrance is clearly visible from St. George, on either side of the concrete spire.

markers.title: Main entrance to Innis College Student Residence
markers.desc: A level path leads to a powered, glass door under a steel arch.   Entrance faces west and is clearly visible from St. George Street.

markers.title: Entrance to Thomas Fisher Rare Book Library
markers.desc:
Manual door at the top of a large outdoor staircase.
The entrance ison the east side of the building, facing St. George.
This entrance is clearly visible from St. George, and serves as a cross-over entrance between Rare Books and Robarts library.

markers.title: Main entrance to Claude T. Bissel Building
markers.desc: Powered door reachable by a long stair from St. George Street leads to the vestibule connecting Robarts Library and the Bissel Building. Entry to the Bissel building is located within this vestibule.  Entrance stair is visible from St. George Street.

markers.title: Main entrance to Innis College
markers.desc:
Powered door under a building colonnade.
The sidewalk level is raised up, by several stairs to the south and by a slight ramp to the north.
The entrance faces east and is partially visible (under the colonnade) from St. George.

markers.title: SE entrance to Innis College
markers.desc:
Secondary manual door at street level.
This entrance faces south and is visible from Sussex Ave.

markers.title: SW entrance to Innis
markers.desc:
Secondary manual door at street level.
This entrance faces south and is visible from Sussex Ave.

markers.title: NW entrance to Innis College
markers.desc:
Secondary powered door at street level.
This entrance faces north and is not visible from the street.

markers.title: NW entrance to Innis
markers.desc:
Secondary manual door at street level.
This entrance faces west and is not visible from the street.

markers.title: Main entrance to Knox College
markers.desc:
Heavy double manual doors up several stairs from the sidewalk.
This entrance faces west and is clearly visible from the street.
You can use this entrance to cross through the courtyard breezeway on your way to the Knox chapel.

markers.title: Main entrance to University College
markers.desc:
Large manual doors reachable via outdoor stairs.
This entrance faces south and is clearly visible from the circle.

markers.title: Main accessible entrance to UC
markers.desc:
Powered door at the end of the colonnade inside the UC courtyard.
The door faces west, but is reached by the steeply sloped (1:8) road/path entrance on the north side of the building. This pathway is located at the very end of Tower Road.

markers.title: Main entrance to the University of Toronto Arts Centre
markers.desc:
Powered door under the colonnade in the UC courtyard.
The door faces south, and is reached by crossing through UC, into the courtyard and under the colonnade.
The wheelchair route requires using the steep road/path at th end of Tower Road.

markers.title: Main entrance to Hart House
markers.desc:
Very heavy powered doors at the top of an exterior stairway. Entrance faces south and is visible from Hart House Circle.
Power door mechanism operated by turning and pulling gently on the handles.

markers.title: Entrance to Sammy's Student Exchange
markers.desc:
Manual door that is below grade, down several stairs from sidewalk level.
The entrance faces south and is visible in the corner of the outdoor patio.

markers.title: Main accessible entrance to Hart House
markers.desc: Powered door at the top of a wheelchair accessible ramp. This entrance faces south, onto Tower road. It is clearly visible from the parking area. Entrance also provides accessible entry into the Justina M. Barnicke Gallery.

markers.title: Entrance to Hart House Theatre
markers.desc:
Manual door that is below grade, down a set of stairs under a black awning.
This entrance faces south and can be seen from the circle if you look for the black awning.

markers.title: Secondary entrance to Hart House
markers.desc:
Heavy manual door at the top of an exterior stair.
Entrance faces south and is clearly visible from the circle.

markers.title: Main entrance to Alumni House
markers.desc:
Powered door approachable by ramp and stair.
The entrance faces east and is clearly visible from the circle.

markers.title: Main entrance to SGS
markers.desc:
Manual door approachable by outdoor stair.
The entrances faces west and is clearly visible from St. George St.

markers.title: Main entrance to Macdonald Mowat
markers.desc:
Powered door approachable by ramp and stair.
The door faces south and is visible from St. George st. if one is approaching from the south.

markers.title: Main entrance to Trinity
markers.desc: Manual door approachable by several sets of stairs.  Entry faces south and is clearly visible from Hoskin Avenue.

markers.title: Main accessible entrance for Trinity
markers.desc:
Powered door approachable by stair and ramp.
The door faces west and is clearly visible from the parking lane on the west side of Trinity.
The entrance is not visible from Hoskin Ave.

markers.title: North Entrance to Trinity College
markers.desc:
Manual door approachable by level path.
Entrance on the north side of Trinity, leading inside to the dining hall area only.
This entrance is somewhat difficult on the building interior, but is the only level entrance for the dining area.

markers.title: Main Entrance to the Trinity Chapel
markers.desc: Powered door approachable by level path and leads directly into the chapel (and only the chapel). The entrance faces east and is visible from Hoskin Ave.  Door is typically locked but can be opened on request during chapel services.

markers.title: Main entrance to Law
markers.desc: Powered door approachable by level path. The entrance faces north-east and is clearly visible from the Faculty of Law parking area. The Colonnade is clearly visible from Queen's Park West.

markers.title: Secondary entrance to Law
markers.desc: Manual entrance approachable via a raised walkway which has a ramp and stairs. The courtyard is not visible from the street, and access to it requires going up many steps from Philosopher's walk.

markers.title: Main entrance to Music
markers.desc: Powered door approachable by ramp and stair. The doorway faces east and is clearly visible from the Law/Music parking area. The entrance is not visible from Queen's Park Crescent.

markers.title: Secondary entrance to Music
markers.desc: Manual door approachable from a narrow bridge from Philosopher's walk. The door faces west and is not visible from any roadway.

markers.title: Main entrance to the Varsity Pavillion
markers.desc: Powered door approachable by a low-slope covered pathway from Devonshire. The entrance faces west and is recognizable from the street by the modern colonnade leading to the doorway.

markers.title: North entrance to the Varsity Pavilion
markers.desc: Powered door approachable from level sidewalk. The entrance faces north and is clearly visible from the Bloor street. It is adjacent to the Varsity box office.

markers.title: Rear entrance to Varsity Centre
markers.desc: Powered door approachable by level path from the parking lot. The entrance faces east over Philosopher's Walk, and is partially hidden from the parking lot. The path up from Philosopher's Walk is very steep (1:9).

markers.title: Main entrance to the John W. Graham Library
markers.desc: Powered door approachable by stair and ramp. The entrance faces east into the parking lane way between Trinity College and the Munk School.

markers.title: Main entrance to the north wing of the Munk School
markers.desc: Powered door approachable by level path under an open colonnade. The entrance faces west and is partially visible from Devonshire Ave.

markers.title: Main entrance to the south wing of the Munk School
markers.desc: Powered door approachable by level path under an open colonnade. The entrance is partially visible from Devonshire Ave.

markers.title: Main entrance to the Ignatieff Theatre
markers.desc: Powered door approachable by stair from the west and ramp (and stair) from the east.The entrance faces west and is visible from Devonshire Ave. The route from the parking lot is the path around the building starting on the east side.

markers.title: Main entrance to Gerald Larkin
markers.desc: Manual glasss door approachable from stairs to the west and a ramp at the east end of the colonnade. The entrance is partially visible from the street, somewhat obscured by the colonnade beside.

markers.title: Secondary accessible entrance to Gerald Larkin Building
markers.desc: Powered door approachable from the level path to the parking lot (to the north), a ramp to the south and a stairway to the east. The entrance is not visible from the street and is under the cover of a concrete colonnade.

markers.title: Entrance to the Massey courtyard
markers.desc: A manual entrance with the residence porter and courtyard located directly inside.

markers.title: Main entrance to St. Hilda's
markers.desc:
Manual door approached by 4 stairs from the circular drive.
The entrance faces west and is clearly visible from Devonshire Place.

markers.title: Designated accessible entrance to St. Hilda's
markers.desc: The lane way on the south side of St. Hilda's leads to the designated accessible entrance, however the door is not powered. There is a bell to ring for assistance.

markers.title: Main entrance to the University College Union
markers.desc: Powered door approached by a level pathway along the south side of the building. The entrance is not visible from the street, tucked behind a covered wooden porch.

markers.title: Main entrance to Morrison Hall
markers.desc: Powered entrance approachable by level path. The entrance faces west and is clearly visible from St. George street.

markers.title: Accessible entrance to Galbraith and Sanford Fleming
markers.desc: Powered door approached by a low-slope ramp. This entrance serves as the accessible entrance for both Sanford Fleming and Galbraith buildings. It is on the North side of Sanford Fleming and is clearly visible from Galbraith rd.

markers.title: South main entrance to Sanford Fleming
markers.desc: Manual doorway approachable by stair from King's College road. The entrance faces west and is clearly visible from the street.

markers.title: North main entrance to Sanford Fleming
markers.desc: Manual doorway approachable by stair from King's College road. The entrance faces west and is clearly visible from the street.

markers.title: Main entrance to Galbraith
markers.desc: Manual doors approachable by stair from King's College Road. The entrances face west and are clearly visible from the street.

markers.title: Main entrance to Cumberland house
markers.desc: Powered door approached by stair or by curving landscape ramp. This entrance faces west and is visible from the street.

markers.title: Main entrance to the Eng. Annex
markers.desc: Antique manual door approached by 3 steps from the pedestrian alley between the Pratt and Sanford Fleming buildings.

markers.title: Designated accessible entrance to the Engineering Annex
markers.desc: The ramp designates the north entrance as the most accessible, however the door does not have a power opener. The ramp is short and steep and faces the pedestrian alley between the Pratt and Sanford Fleming buildings.

markers.title: Accessible entrance to the Pratt and Wallberg buildings
markers.desc: Powered door approached by an extensive white-railed access ramp. The entrance faces east, and the ramp is visible from King's College road. Via a cross-through the Pratt building, this entrance also serves as the accessible entrance for Wallberg.

markers.title: Main Entrance to the Pratt Building
markers.desc: Manual door approached by a level path. The entrance faces north and is only partially visible from King's College road.

markers.title: Main entrance to Wallberg (east)
markers.desc: Wallberg has 2 main entrances facing College street. Each has manual doors approached by a large stair, clearly visible from the street.

markers.title: Main entrance to Wallberg (west)
markers.desc: Wallberg has 2 main entrances facing College street. Each has manual doors approached by a large stair, clearly visible from the street.

markers.title: Main entrance to the Koffler Student Services Centre
markers.desc: Manual door approached by a substantial outdoor stair. The entrance faces south and is clearly visible from College street.

markers.title: Main entrance to the Campus Bookstore
markers.desc: This door at the south-west corner of Koffler leads directly into the Campus Bookstore. The entrance is at grade but does not have a power opener. The bookstore can be used as a cross-through into the rest of the Koffler building.

markers.title: Cross over from Bahen Centre to the Koffler building.
markers.desc: Interior power doors and a ramp allow cross-over from Koffler into the Bahen Centre. Near this crossover, Bahen has elevators leading to the underground parking garage.

markers.title: Accessible entrance to the Koffler Student Services Centre
markers.desc: Power door approached by stairs and a ramp. The entrance faces east and is clearly visible from St. George st.

markers.title: Main Entrance to the Bahen Centre for Information Technology
markers.desc: Powered door approached by ramp and stair. The entrance faces west and is clearly visible from St. George st.

markers.title: Courtyard accessible entrance to the Bahen Centre
markers.desc: Powered door approached by level path. The entrance faces south into the Bahen courtyard, and is not visible from the street.

markers.title: Parking elevator accessible entrance
markers.desc: Powered door approached by level path. The entrance faces south into the Bahen courtyard, and is not visible from the street. The below-grade parking elevators are just inside this entrance.

markers.title: West side entrance to the Bahen Centre
markers.desc: Powered door approached by level path. This entrance faces west into the narrow pedestrian lane that runs from Russell St. to the Bahen Centre. It is not visible from the street.

markers.title: North accessible entrance to the Bahen Centre.
markers.desc: Powered door approached by level sidewalk. The entrance faces north and is visible from the street if travelling south down St. George St.

markers.title: Entrance to the Victorian House at the Bahen Centre
markers.desc: Manual entrance approached by several outdoor stairs. The entrance face east onto St. George St. and is clearly visible from the street.

markers.title: Main entrance to the Fields Institute
markers.desc: Powered entrance approached by level path, under a large modern awning. The entrance faces south and is clearly visible from College St.

markers.title: Courtyard entrance to the Field's Institute
markers.desc: Manual entrance approachable by stair only, via the rear patio. This entrance faces south and is only visible from within the pedestrian courtyard.

markers.title: Accessible entrance to the Architecture building
markers.desc: Powered door approached by level sidewalk. There is a short ramp on the building interior inside the entrance. The door faces west and is clearly visible from Huron St.

markers.title: Main entrance to 215 Huron St.
markers.desc: Powered door approached by level sidewalk. This entrance faces west and is clearly visible from Huron St.

markers.title: Main entrance to Gage Building
markers.desc: Manual door approached by stair only. This entrance faces east into the Gage parking lot, and is visible from College St. when travelling west.

markers.title: Main entrance to the mining building
markers.desc: Manual door approached by a large stair. This entrance faces south and is clearly visible from College St.

markers.title: Accessible entrance to the Mining Building
markers.desc: Powered entrance approached by a ramp. The entrance faces east and is difficult to see because it is built into the side of the stair of the main entrance. The blue accessibility sign is clearly visible.

markers.title: Main entrance to the Haultain Building
markers.desc: Manual door approached by stair. The entrance faces and is visible only from the service/pedestrian route through the engineering annex.

markers.title: Secondary entrance to Mining
markers.desc: Manual door approached by a small stair. This entrance faces north and is only visible from the service/pedestrian alley of the mining/engineering annex.

markers.title: Designated accessible entrance to the Haultain Building
markers.desc: Powered door approached by a very short, steep and rough curb ramp right at the entrance. It is a steel service door roughly for accessible use. The entrance faces west and is only visible from within the dead-end alley.

markers.title: Main entrance to Mechanical Engineering
markers.desc: Powered door approached by a long level path. The entrance faces west and is clearly visible, under a large awning, from King's College road.

markers.title: Secondary accessible entrance to Mechanical Engineering
markers.desc: Powered door approachable by level path. This entrance faces north and is visible from the street.

markers.title: North entrance to the Rosebrugh Building
markers.desc: Powered entrance approached by level path. The entrance faces north but is not visible from King's College road. The route to the entrance, down the parking road for the Medical Science, is somewhat sloped.

markers.title: Main entrance to the Rosebrugh Building
markers.desc: Manual door approached by level sidewalk. The entrance faces east, sharing the wide modern pedestrian concourse that leads to to the Donnelly building. It is partially visible from the street.

markers.title: Accessible entrance to the Fitzgerald Building
markers.desc: Powered door approachable by straight level path. The entrance faces south and is clearly visible from College Street.

markers.title: Main entrance to the Pharmacy Building
markers.desc: Powered door approached by level path. This entrance faces west and is visible from the street.

markers.title: Secondary entrance to the Pharmacy Building
markers.desc: Manual door approached by level path. This entrance faces north and is not visible from the street.

markers.title: Main entrance to the C. David Naylor Building
markers.desc: Manual door approached by a large outdoor stair. The entrance faces north-east and is somewhat visible from Queen's Park West.

markers.title: Accessible entrance to C. David Naylor Building
markers.desc: Powered door approached by a sloped path. This entrance faces west, into the service/pedestrian corridor between this building and Pharmacy. It is located next to the building loading bay. The entrance is not visible from the street.

markers.title: Main entrance
markers.desc:
Manual door at the top of an exposed stair (6 steps).
Entrance faces west and is clearly visible from St. George Street.

markers.title: Secondary entrance to the Physical Geography Building
markers.desc:
Manual door at the top of an exposed stair.
Entrance faces south and is visible from Galbraith road.

markers.title: Main Entrance to 49 St. George Street
markers.desc:
Manual door at the top of an exposed stair.
Entrance faces south and is visible from the street.

markers.title: East Entrance to Howard Ferguson Dining Hall
markers.desc:
Six steps leading up to manual door.
Entrance is not visible from St. George Street and lightly obscured by vegeation when approaching from Back Campus.

markers.title: South Entrance to Sir Daniel Wilson Residence
markers.desc:
Six steps leading up to manual door.
Entrance is not visible from St. George Street and faces south onto the exterior courtyard.

markers.title: Northwest courtyard entrance to Sir Daniel Wilson Residence
markers.desc:
Six steps leading up to manual door.
Entrance is not visible from St. George Street and faces east onto the exterior courtyard.

markers.title: Central passageway entrance
markers.desc:
Single high step to a manual door.
Entrance is visually obscured from St. George Street and faces east into the central passageway.

markers.title: Southwest courtyard entrance to Sir Daniel Wilson Residence
markers.desc:
Six steps leading to a manual door.
Entrance is not visible from St. George Street and faces east onto the exterior courtyard.

markers.title: Second southwest exterior courtyard entrance to Sir Daniel Wilson Residence
markers.desc:
Six steps leading to a manual door.
Entrance is not visible from St. George Street and faces north onto the exterior courtyard.

markers.title: South exterior courtyard entrance to Sir Daniel Wilson Residence
markers.desc:
Six steps leading to a manual door.
Entrance is not visible from St. George Street and faces North onto the exterior courtyard.

markers.title: Southeast exterior courtyard entrance to Sir Daniel Wilson Residence
markers.desc:
Six steps leading to a manual door.
Entrance is not visible from St. George Street and faces north onto the exterior courtyard.

markers.title: East entrance to Sir Daniel Wilson Residence
markers.desc:
Six steps leading to a manual door.
Entrance is not visible from St. George Street and lightly obscured from King's College Circle.

markers.title: East entrance to Medical Sciences Building
markers.desc:
Entrance is visible from Queen's Park Crescent pathway and sidewalk.
Path leads to a small step at a manual door.

markers.title: West Entrance to C. David Naylor Building
markers.desc: Entrance is below grade and accessed by stairs.  Approach is from the North via the Medical Sciences Building or South via the rear walkways of the Dan Pharmacy Building.  Pathway leading to entrance is narrow and not visible from Queen's Park Cres.

markers.title: South Entry to the Pharmacy Building
markers.desc: Entrance approached from a level pathway and is visible from College Street.  Door is operated by a power opener from the inside only.  Recommend using the main accessible entry immediately to the east and also visible from College Street.

markers.title: North Entrance to the Fitzgerald Building
markers.desc: Stairs lead to a manual doorway.  Entrance faces north and is directly opposite the south entrance to the Meidcal Sciences Building.  Not visible from Queen's Park Crescent.

markers.title: Rear Entry to the Fitzgerald Building
markers.desc: A single step and a manual door leads to an interior stairway.  Entry is not visible from the street and approached by a narrow pathway at the rear of the builiding.

markers.title: Second Rear Entrance to Fitzgerald Building
markers.desc: An uneven, textured pathway leads to a manual door with a single step.  The entrance faces east and most easily approached from the south via the pathway between the Fitzgerald and Pharmacy buildings.

markers.title: Interior connection between CCBR and Medical Sciences Building
markers.desc: Interior Hallway provides a level and accessible through connection between the main levels of the Donnelly Centre for Cellular and Biomolecular Research and the Medical Sciences Building.

markers.title: East Entry to the Mining Building
markers.desc:
A long, angled stairway leads to a manual door.
Entrance faces east and is obscured behind trees when viewed from College Street.
Guard rails around stairs block all but the northerly approach.

markers.title: West Entrance to the Mining Building
markers.desc: Large stairs lead to a manual door. Entrance faces west and is easily visible from College Street and Kings College Road.

markers.title: North Entrance to the Mechanical Engineering Building
markers.desc: A single step leads to a manual door.  Entrance faces north and is visible, but distant, from King's College Road.  Approached by a level pathway and driveway from King's College Road.

markers.title: Courtyard Entrance to the D.L. Pratt Building
markers.desc: Single step leads to a manual door. Entrance faces east and is partially visible from King's College Road when walking north. Entrance serves the parking lot immediately adjacent.
